intro: Frangularia nigra, commonly known as the black frangularia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and striking, pendulous flowers that range from yellow to orange in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, angular seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
